response: narrative=Elliott Williams, avoiding authorities, went missing from his home. His sister and colleague Nathan Robinson speculated a possible sea kayaking accident near the military base at 32 Glenorchy Road, EH39 4QE. Police later traced him to 61 Old Abbey Road, resolving concerns.

narrative=Elliott Williams went missing from the military base area near the neighborhood cafe. He was last seen speaking to Nathan Robinson, his colleague, before heading towards a nearby park with plans to attempt sea kayaking. Witnesses report seeing a kayak paddle drifting away, suggesting a possible sea kayaking accident. Despite initial searches, Elliott was only found days later at a different location, indicating he may have drifted or wandered ashore elsewhere.

narrative=Elliott Williams was last seen leaving the community center near a military base. Concern grew when his sister Linda Kerr noticed he hadn’t returned home. A search effort led to his safe return at a nearby location days later.

narrative=Elliott Williams, a 91-year-old retired health visitor, was reported missing from his home at 90 Haymarket Terrace, Edinburgh. Known to avoid authorities, Elliott was living in an assisted living facility and was suspected to have quietly left his residence without informing the staff or any acquaintances, including his friend Ian Smith. Initially deemed low risk due to his calm demeanor and familiarity with the area, the prolonged absence raised concerns among those who knew him. His behavioral pattern suggested a desire for solitude, occasionally evading official notice. The facility's staff, noticing his absence, reached out to Ian Smith, who had not heard from Wyatt. After almost a day of searching, police traced him back to his residence, safe and unharmed, having returned unnoticed.

narrative=Elliott Williams, a 91-year-old individual, was reported missing from his home at 90 Haymarket Terrace, Edinburgh. Concerns were raised after he failed to return from a casual outing planned near a military base. His sister and colleague, Nathan Robinson, became worried and reached out to the authorities, fearing a possible sea kayaking accident had occurred near North Berwick. Given his age and disability, the risk level was initially high. A search around locations he frequented, including Pheasant Walk and Cluny Drive, was initiated. After days of intensive efforts by search teams and local authorities, Elliott was thankfully located at 61 Old Abbey Road by police, approximately three days later, safe and unharmed.
